data.text: @mariots Fascinating! Sort of an unintended syndromic surveillance feature.

@mariots I love how your members seem to learn - as the turnout in each wave gets stronger… 

Could be underreported case or that people pickup tele-health more often…
@scottleibrand Not yet but good idea! We'll look into it
@aleksj Biggest confounders are geography and age (mostly under 65), but can probably correct for that next time

@davecanarro That's probably one reason, but the other one surely is testing data reporting lag. Eg, public data cases go down every weekend. Combination of patient behavior (don't get tested on weekends) & reporting lag (labs closed) causes that. Probably same effects at work here
@mariots Fascinating! How’s your customer population representative of the country as a whole? Maybe it’s possible to correct for the bias.

@mariots Interesting... but why? 
Are the conversations about covid or about the symptoms which later turn out to be covid?
@mariots Nice. Is that data publicly available on a frequently updated dashboard?
